credential.description: Credential to use for SecretHub authentication. Can also be sourced from SECRETHUB_CREDENTIAL.

credential_passphrase.description: Passphrase to unlock the authentication passed in `credential`. Can also be sourced from SECRETHUB_CREDENTIAL_PASSPHRASE.

account_name.description: The name of the account (username or service ID) for which the permission holds.

dir.description: The path of the directory on which the permission holds.

permission.description: The permission that the account has on the given directory: read, write or admin

path.description: The path where the secret will be stored.

value.description: The secret contents. Either `value` or `generate` must be defined.

charsets.description: Define the set of characters to randomly generate a password from. Options are all, alphanumeric, numeric, lowercase, uppercase, letters, symbols and human-readable.

length.description: The length of the secret to generate.

min.description: Ensure that the generated secret contains at least n characters from the given character set. Note that adding constraints reduces the strength of the secret.

use_symbols.description: Whether the secret should contain symbols.

credential.description: The credential of the service account.

description.description: A description of the service so others will recognize it.

repo.description: The path of the repository on which the service operates.

description.description: A description of the service so others will recognize it.

kms_key_arn.description: The ARN of the KMS key to use to encrypt and decrypt your SecretHub key material.

repo.description: The path of the repository on which the service operates.

role.description: The role name or ARN of the IAM role that should have access to this service account.

description.description: A description of the service so others will recognize it.

kms_key_id.description: The Resource ID of the Cloud KMS key to use to encrypt and decrypt your SecretHub key material.

repo.description: The path of the repository on which the service operates.

service_account_email.description: The email of the Google Service Account that provides the identity of the SecretHub service account.

path.description: The path where the secret is stored. To use a specific version, append the version number to the path, separated by a colon (path:version). Defaults to the latest version.
